title: What kind of questions on Quora aren't OK? What is Quora's policy on question deletion? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are three types of question deletions on Quora: Deletions made by the user who added the question. After adding a question, the OP (original poster of the question) has a grace period during which he or she is permitted to delete the question; this grace period ends when a certain level of activity on the page has occurred. This policy is consistent with Quora's philosophy that questions belong to the community and OPs do not have ownership over their questions—see: Should I feel a sense of responsibility over questions that I ask on Quora?Deletions requested by a user regarding a questioContinue Reading

In summary, those that flout Quora’s policies. Among them, the one I (and probably a vast majority of other Quorans) tolerate the least would be Quora’s BNBR policy. In light of that, the following types of questions will get banned: Questions that disguise the asker’s malignant intentions. I have often seen questions that are poorly phrased, and that betray the asker’s bigoted opinions. These questions are often insincere and only serve to project the asker’s hateful opinions, and will not be tolerated.Questions that the asker him/herself has deleted. The possible reasons for reporting a question are: Harassment: Disparaging or adversarial towards a person or groupSpam: Undisclosed promotion for a link or productInsincere: Not seeking genuine answersPoorly Written: Not in English or has very bad formatting, grammar, and spelling(There is a fifth option: incorrect topics, but that will not lead to a question being removed). Any of the above can be a reason for a question to be deleted. It is up to Quora to decide what kind of content they are willing to allow on their forum.
